objects.name: HORDWARNING
objects.string: MODO HORDA: Cuidado, uma horda gigantesca de demônios se aproxima. Você tem 9999 pergaminhos para usar, mas use-os sabiamente, pois não são infinitos.

content.text:
This text use the default bitmap font.
Use a custom Bitmap Font to create your own texts.

objects.name: TutorialText
objects.string: O TEXTO DO TUTORIAL E DA FALA DO DANIEL VAI VIR AQUI

parameters: "Infelizmente você perdeu, mas como sou generoso, vou dar mais outra chance... você vai perder de novo e de novo de qualquer forma... HAHAHA Toque duas vezes para continuar."

objects.name: TutorialText
objects.string: O TEXTO DO TUTORIAL E DA FALA DO DANIEL VAI VIR AQUI

parameters: "Aqueles caras estão tão confiantes de que me derrotaram..."
"Mal sabem eles que ainda estou aqui, mais forte do que nunca..."
"Vou mandar uns demônios para virem destruir essa cidade..."
"Você terá cinco poderes: terra, água, fogo, ar e tempestade"
"Você pode usá-los para derrotar os demônios. Cada poder tem um preço."
"Esse preço no caso são os pergaminhos. Eles serão spawnados automaticamente. Você pode tocá-los para pegá-los."
"Você pode selecionar um poder e tocar duas vezes no local onde deseja conjurá-lo."
"Use-os sabiamente, pois alguns poderes, apesar de mais potentes, são mais caros e tem efeitos que duram menos tempo."

objects.name: Objective
objects.string: Use os poderes para derrotar os demônios que aparecerem. Não os deixe se aproximarem da cidade.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DoubleClick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check for a double-click with a mouse, or a double-tap on a touchscreen.
description: Allow you to check for double-clicks with the left, middle, or right button of a mouse. It will also allow you to detect double-taps on touchscreens.

Please note: Touch devices do not have alternatives for middle/right clicks. Taps on a touch device will get counted for _any_ use of these conditions, so you should either design your controls accordingly, or build out separate events if the device has a touch screen.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified mouse button is clicked twice in a short amount of time.
eventsFunctions.name: HasDoubleClicked
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ mouse button is double-clicked (or double-tap on a touchscreen)

parameters.longDescription: As touch devices do not have middle/right tap equivalents, you will need to account for this within your events if you're not using the left mouse button and building for touch devices.
parameters.name: MouseButton

eventsFunctions.description: Set the maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to be considered as a double click.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the double-click maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to _PARAM1_s

parameters.longDescription: By default, this value is 0.5 seconds.
parameters.name: MaxDelay

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
description: Enables players to click and drag on physics objects to move them.  The object retains velocity when the click is released, allowing players to fling objects across the screen.
- The default "draggable" behavior will not work on objects with the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
The Parking Jam example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://parking-jam)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

events.comment: Create mouse joints and save the joint ID
Update the position of the mouse joint to follow the mouse

eventsFunctions.description: Start dragging object.
eventsFunctions.name: StartDragging

eventsFunctions.description: Release dragged object.
eventsFunctions.name: ReleaseDrag

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is being dragged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsBeingDragged

eventsFunctions.description: the mouse button used to move the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MouseButton

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum joint force (in Newtons) of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxForce

eventsFunctions.description: the joint frequency (per second) of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Frequency

eventsFunctions.description: the joint damping ratio (range: 0 to 1) of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Damping

eventsFunctions.description: Check if automatic dragging is enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAutomaticDraggingEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) automatic dragging with the mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: SetEnableAutomaticDragging

propertyDescriptors.label: Enable automatic dragging
propertyDescriptors.description: If automatic dragging is disabled, use the "Start drag" and "Release drag" actions.
propertyDescriptors.name: EnableAutomaticDragging

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteContinuousBar
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

events.comment: This is done after the events to allow users to read the previous value at the end of the change.

eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is full.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Update the previous resource value of _PARAM0_

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteContinuousBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateLayout

eventsFunctions.name: IsChanging

eventsFunctions.name: IsLabelShown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Pauses a recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resumes a paused recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
